summary: This is a psychiatric observation log for an inmate on suicide watch, covering the period July 24-30, 2019. The log tracks the inmate's meals, showers, and activities. The name of the inmate appears to be redacted or heavily obscured, but the context strongly suggests it is Jeffrey Epstein, who was in custody at the time. The document includes notes on his behavior and records multiple legal visits.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the psychiatric observation log. The log tracks his meals, showers, behavior, and legal visits while in custody.

events.title: Psychiatric Observation Period
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was placed on psychiatric observation/suicide watch. The log documents his daily activities, intake of meals and liquids, showering, and behavior notes over this week-long period.

events.title: Multiple Legal Visits
events.description: The log records multiple instances of "Epstein" being "OUT on LEGAL VISIT" throughout the day on July 30, 2019.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (MCC New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was on a formal psychiatric observation/suicide watch protocol from at least July 24 to July 30, 2019.
The observation log was maintained at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The log meticulously records his consumption of meals, liquids, and showers, indicating close monitoring.
On July 30, 2019, he had multiple legal visits, as noted by entries stating he was "OUT on LEGAL VISIT."
The inmate's name on the form is redacted/obscured, but the context and subsequent references to "Epstein" confirm his identity.
